sub_title: JHipster co-lead, Java Champion, Staff Dev Advocate @ Okta, Java, JS, Rust, Cloud Native Advocate, Author, Speaker bit.ly/JHIPSTER-BOOKS
summary:
Short Summary:
-----------------------
Tinkerer and builder. Passionate technologist. Polyglot developer with expertise in Java, JS/TS, Go, Rust, microservices, cloud-native, DevOps, solution architecture, visualization/prototyping, and proposal writing. Passionate about emerging technologies. Hands-on expert in Enterprise Architecture, Microservices, Cloud & Containers, UX Implementation, rich web development, and hybrid mobile app design. Published Author, International Speaker & Blogger.

Open Source aficionado & community leader, Java, JS, Rust, Cloud Native Advocate, a core contributor and co-lead for JHipster

Super power: Can learn anything in a bunch of days and start writing about best practices in it :)

Long Summary:
-----------------------

From an Electrical engineer to a software designer, that's my story. I would like to call myself a software engineer with a soldering iron. My love for tech started in high school, I was assembling home theatre systems and PCs for pocket money, learning from the internet. This led to me graduating as an Electrical and Electronics Engineer from Anna University, Chennai in 2009.

I wanted to be a Robotics Engineer but the universe had other plans. Turned out I was good at coding more than the soldering iron, so started off as a trainee in Tata consultancy services in 2010.

From there on I have worn hats of a Java developer, Business Analyst, Program Manager, Tech Lead, Solution Designer, Product developer, Principal developer & Developer Advocate till now.

I wrote proposals, designed software and made prototypes as part of a solutions team previously for an Airline client of TCS

I worked at XebiaLabs, building DevOps and Cloud Native products. I currently work for Okta as a developer advocate

Since coding at work alone doesn't satisfy my inner nerd, I contribute to open source software community. I'm the co-lead & active contributor for JHipster, a cool application development platform (www.jhipster.tech). I also host multiple OSS tools and Projects and write blogs. I have also published two books.

My love for Robotics, Quad-copters, and Astronomy have become my current hobbies.

treasury_media.title: Full Stack Development with JHipster - Second Edition
treasury_media.description: Written by the core development team of JHipster and fully updated for JHipster 6, Java 11, and Spring Boot 2.1, this book will show you how to build modern web applications with real-world examples and best practices

treasury_media.title: 🚀 Demystifying memory management in modern programming languages
treasury_media.description: Let us take a look at how modern programming languages manage memory.

treasury_media.title: Full Stack Development with JHipster
treasury_media.description: JHipster is a development platform to generate, develop, and deploy Spring Boot and Angular applications and Spring microservices. It provides you with a variety of tools that will help you quickly build modern web applications.This book will be your...

treasury_media.title: Angular vs React Smackdown by Matt Raible, Deepu K Sasidharan
treasury_media.description: This talk discusses the pros and cons of Angular and React and shows how they're similar, as well as how they're different. Deepu will defend React, Matt wil...

treasury_media.title: Angular vs React - Devoxx BE 2017
treasury_media.description: This talk discusses the pros and cons of Angular and React and shows how they're similar, as well as how they're different. Deepu will defend React, Matt will defend Angular. We'll even show you the same app created with React and Angular via JHipster.

treasury_media.title: JHipster React - Devoxx BE 2017
treasury_media.description: JHipster is a widely used and exponentially growing platform to create Angular + Spring web applications and micro services. We recently started working on adding react support for JHipster and in this quick session, we would like to showcase the Beta version and show how to generate full-fledged React apps with JHipster.

treasury_media.title: Easy Microservices with JHipster - Devoxx BE 2017
treasury_media.description:
10,000 microservices are generated each month using JHipster!

During this in-depth session by the two JHipster lead developers, we’ll detail:

How to develop and deploy microservices easily
Scalability and failover of microservices
The JHipster Registry for scaling, configuring and monitoring microservices
Common architecture patterns and pitfalls

treasury_media.title: Building Spring boot + Angular4 apps in minutes with JHipster - Deepu K Sasidharan @ Spring I/O 2017
treasury_media.description: Spring I/O 2017 - 18 -19 May, Barcelona JHipster (https://jhipster.github.io/) is a widely-used, Open Source application generator platform for creating Spri...

treasury_media.title: JHipster university session @ Devoxx Belgium 2016 by Julien Dubois and Deepu K Sasidharan
treasury_media.description:
A JHipster university session @ Devoxx Belgium 2016 by JHipster founder and lead Julien Dubois and co-lead Deepu K Sasidharan.
JHipster is a widely-used, Open Source application generator for creating Spring Boot + AngularJS projects in seconds! JHipster comes packed with tools, tips and ideas to make you generate, code and deploy your application faster than you thought it...

awards.title: Java Champion
awards.description: The Java Champions Program consists of a unique group of skilled Java technologists and community leaders sponsored by Oracle. Java Champions come from a broad cross-section of the Java community. They are leaders, influencers and enablers who help grow the size of the Java community. Java Champions are active in many ways such as actively participating in Java projects, engaging with Java User Group communities, speaking at conferences, authoring content, teaching other developers, fostering inclusive participation and so much more. https://dev.java/community/jcs/

profile_positions.description: Developer Advocate for Auth0 at Okta. My goal would be to make Okta and Auth0 a well-known name in the DevOps, Java, and Rust world and contribute to the DevOp, Java, and Rust community on behalf of Okta in terms of education, content, tools and services. Special focus on k8s, CICD, infra as code, Java, Rust, Go and cloud
profile_positions.title: Staff Developer Advocate

profile_positions.description:
Lead developer and one of the main contributor of JHipster(www.jhipster.tech), a well-known Web application development platform. Creator of JDL Studio and various JHipster plug-in modules.
Maintainer and co-creator of JHipster online (https://start.jhipster.tech), JHipster Registry and so on.

Responsibilities :
As a project & community lead and development board member, responsible for attending queries, issues and troubleshoot/fix bugs reported. 
Triaging and project planning. Major release planning. Release management.
Project evangelization through conference talks, books, and meetups.
Creating and organizing feature roadmap, policy drafting, setting team goals and direction. 
Support in the decision-making process of the team.
New team member induction and mentoring of contributors. 
Contributorencouragement and mediation.
Created and maintained core features of the tool over time, revamped the project from time to time to adhere and adapt to technology changes in JS and NodeJS ecosystem. 
Lead the development of Angular and React implementations for the project, Architect and implemented a plug-in hook & blueprint mechanism for the tool, Created a NodeJS CLI for the tool.
profile_positions.title: Co-lead

profile_positions.description:
Founder and Editor of Technorage (https://deepu.tech/blogs/), a technology blog with more than 20k monthly views and more than 10k monthly unique users

- Author of technology blogs on the website
- Webmaster
profile_positions.title: Founder/Author

profile_positions.description: Developer Advocate for DevOps. My goal would be to make Okta a well known name in the DevOps world and contribute to the DevOps community on behalf of Okta in terms of education, content, tools and services. Special focus on k8s, CICD, infra as code and cloud
profile_positions.title: Sr. Developer Advocate

profile_positions.description: The goal of Developer Advocates at Adyen is to improve developer experience of developers using our services and to form a bridge between them and the product teams building our products. To achieve this goal we focus on anything that will make life easier for developers using our products and APIs. This includes content creation, creating libraries/SDKs, creating examples and demos, organising developer focused events, driving features and improvements that impacts developer experience, documentation strategies, product/api evangelism and so on.
profile_positions.title: Sr. Developer Advocate

profile_positions.description:
Part of a team building cloud-native solutions, best practices and integrations
for AWS, GCP, and Azure using XebiaLabs platform, Kubernetes, Terraform, and
other leading cloud technologies. 
Involved in building product advocacy and developer adoption programs.
Involved in building developer tooling and technology blueprints using Golang and various cloud solutions
profile_positions.title: Principal Developer

profile_positions.description:
Part of an agile DevOps team developing a cutting-edge SaaS DevOps
intelligence product. Was responsible for the architecture and
implementation of the client-side application and API gateway using
Spring, gRPC and JHipster. Built rich visualizations for the product using React, Redux, Typescript, D3, and other supporting technology.
Implemented testing using Karma, Mocha, Chai, Protractor. Involved in
architecture and implementation of base microservice architecture for the
product using JHipster and Spring boot. Involved in continuous
integration and delivery using XL Platform, Docker, Kubernetes and
Google Cloud.
profile_positions.title: Senior Product Developer

profile_positions.description:
Working as a Software Solution Designer and Airline Consultant for a large Airline Client of Tata Consultancy Services. Part of an enterprise solutions and pre-sales team.

- Involved in multiple winning proposals for Travel domain, including RFPs, RFQs, RFIs
- Acted as solution owner for multiple winning proposals for Travel domain. Responsibilities included proposal writing, submission and presentation.
- Provided Technical architecture, Network Architecture, Functional design and Solution architecture for multiple enterprise applications.
- Provided solution visualization and prototypes for multiple large web application proposals.
- Have written RFP, RFQ, RFI and Sales proposals for multiple Airline application/solutions.
- Involved in multiple product offering solution design, UX design and development.
- Ideation, Prototype design and development for new products and solutions.
- New opportunity identification and solution placement.
- Emerging technology identification, adoption and evangelization.
- Create and Host solution/product offerings for customer demo, airline conference and events.
- Designed and implemented a flight monitoring solution with a patented real time flight positions on map and various visualization charts. The app was deployed in AWS Elastic beanstalk for multiple clients. Solution Patent pending.
- Designed and prototype a weight and balance system with auto loading features.
- Designed a food and beverages management system for the airline.
- Designed and prototype a Lounge management system
- Designed and implemented a customer experience management system
profile_positions.title: Software Solution Designer

profile_positions.description:
Technical lead and architect for a multitier enterprise web application for a critical airline business case.

- Involved in ideation, requirement gathering, design, architecture and execution of the web application.
- Acted as solution designer and technical lead for the project
- Involved in identification, adoption and evangelization of new age technology stack
- Responsible for prototyping and architecting of the project
- Involved in client management and scope management 
- Involved in planning and full life cycle execution of the project
- Solution architecture using spring framework full suite, angular js, gradle, scala/gatling, Oracle sql, hibernate, liquibase, jackson, grunt, yeoman and java8
- Lead a team of 8+
profile_positions.title: Technical Lead

profile_positions.description:
Managed a large scale migration to EMD from paper receipts and other forms of MCO in Amadeus platform

- Involved in project planning, tracking and coordination between multiple GDS, Amadeus, Business units and application teams.
- Involved in driving the migration project along with business unit and Airline IT reps
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Part of the Team from TCS supporting the SIA business units in the transformation journey from In-house PSS to Amadeus.

- Involved in large PSS migration from existing TPF platform to Amadeus PSS platform.
- Business owner of Hotel reservation platform supporting the PSS platform.
- Involved in business process testing, change management, process tuning and improvements
profile_positions.title: Business unit support/Business Analyst (TCS)

profile_positions.description:
- J2EE web application developer for multiple large scale applications for large Airline client.
- Experience in full life cycle application development.
- UX designer and developer for multiple web applications.
profile_positions.title: J2EE Web developer

profile_positions.description: TCS internal training program for college graduates.
profile_positions.title: Trainee
